title: 110_hr3513
content: The "Copper Salmon Wilderness Act of 2008" designates the Copper Salmon Wilderness. The Oregon Wilderness Act of 1984 is amended to designate certain land in the Siskiyou National Forest as the Copper Salmon Wilderness, comprising approximately 11,922 acres. The Secretary of Agriculture is required to file a map and legal description for the wilderness area. The Secretary must file a map and legal description of the Copper Salmon Wilderness with the Senate and House Committees. The filed map and description will have the same legal force as the Act, with the Secretary allowed to correct typographical errors. If the wilderness boundary borders a road, the Secretary can establish an offset up to 150 feet from the road's centerline. The filed map and description must be available to the public. The map and legal description of the Copper Salmon Wilderness must be filed with the Senate and House Committees by the Secretary. The filed map and description will have the same legal force as the Act, with the Secretary allowed to correct typographical errors. If the wilderness boundary borders a road, the Secretary can establish an offset up to 150 feet from the road's centerline. The filed map and description must be available to the public for inspection in Forest Service offices. SEC. 3. WILD AND SCENIC RIVER DESIGNATIONS, ELK RIVER, OREGON. Section 3(a)(76) of the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act is amended to designate a 28.2-mile segment of the North Fork Elk River as a scenic river and a 5.5-mile segment as a wild river in Oregon. The South Fork Elk River in Oregon is designated as a scenic river for a 0.9-mile segment and as a wild river for a 4.2-mile segment downstream to its confluence with the North Fork Elk River. SEC. 4. PROTECTION OF TRIBAL RIGHTS. This Act does not diminish any rights of Indian tribes. The Secretary aims to establish a memorandum of understanding with the Coquille Indian Tribe for access to the Copper Salmon Wilderness for historical and cultural activities. SEC. 5. DESIGNATION OF POTENTIAL WILDERNESS AREA, SISKIYOU NATIONAL FOREST, OREGON. Designation of certain National Forest System land in Oregon as a potential wilderness area for inclusion in the Copper Salmon Wilderness. The Secretary will provide a map and legal description of the designated area to the relevant committees. The potential wilderness area designated in Oregon will be managed by the Secretary until designated as wilderness, with a focus on ecological restoration. The map and legal description will be available for public inspection. The planned ecological restoration in the potential wilderness area approved by the Decision Notice allows the use of motorized equipment until designated as wilderness. The Secretary must minimize adverse impacts on wilderness character and resources during restoration. The area will be designated as wilderness once the Secretary publishes the decision. On designation as wilderness, the potential wilderness area will be incorporated into the Copper Salmon Wilderness and administered according to the Wilderness Act and other applicable laws. The Secretary must publish notice of conditions incompatible with the Wilderness Act being removed or 10 years after enactment of the Act. The effective date of the Act will be considered as the date when the lands are designated as wilderness under subsection (e). The House of Representatives passed the Act on April 22, 2008.
